ETYMOLOGY: Compound of 'part' and 'time'. Used as an adjective and adverb to describe work or activities performed for only a portion of the standard working day or week.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adjective: a word that describes or modifies a noun or pronoun
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Working or involving fewer hours than is considered full-time.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 兼职的；非全日制的；部分时间的
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She decided to take a part-time job to focus more on her studies.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她决定找一份兼职工作，以便能更专注于学业。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adverb: a word that modifies a verb, an adjective, or another adverb, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: On a part-time basis; for part of the usual working day or week.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 兼职地；非全日制地；部分时间地
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He works part-time at the bookstore every weekend.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他每个周末都在书店兼职。
